```{r}
#loading necessary packages

library(lme4)
library(ggplot2)
```


```{r}
data <- read.csv("https://github.com/arsell/599-Project/blob/master/data/cleandata.csv?raw=true")
data <- na.omit(data)
```

```{r}
# Investigate age vs educ relationship
p1 <- ggplot(data = data,
             aes(x = age,
                 y = educ)) +
  geom_point(position = "jitter") +
  stat_smooth(geom = "smooth")

p1
```

```{r}
data$religion <- relevel(data$religion, ref="Other")

fit1 <- lm(educ ~ religion + age + region + wealthCat + urban, data=data)
summary(fit1)



fit2 <- lmer(educ ~ religion + age + wealthCat + urban + (1|region),
             data = data,
             REML = FALSE)
summary(fit2)

data$age2 <- data$age^2

fit3 <- lm(educ ~ religion + age + age2 + region + wealthCat + urban, data=data)
summary(fit3)

fit4 <- lmer(educ ~ religion + age + age2 + wealthCat + urban + (1|region),
             data = data,
             REML = FALSE)
summary(fit4)
```

```{r}
fit <- list(fit1, fit2, fit3, fit4)


bic.list <- NULL
for (i in 1:length(fit)){
  bic.list <- BIC(fit[[i]])
}


err.fit1 <- NULL
for (i in 1:nrow(data)){
  data.cv <- data[-i,]
  fit.cv <- lm(educ ~ religion + age + region + wealthCat + urban, data=data.cv)
  yhat <- predict(fit.cv, data[i,])
  err.fit1[i] <- abs(data$educ[i] - yhat)
}

err.fit2 <- NULL
for (i in 1:nrow(data)){
  data.cv <- data[-i,]
  fit.cv <- lmer(educ ~ religion + age + wealthCat + urban + (1|region),
             data = data.cv,
             REML = FALSE)
  yhat <- predict(fit.cv, data[i,])
  err.fit2[i] <- abs(data$educ[i] - yhat)
}

err.fit3 <- NULL
for (i in 1:nrow(data)){
  if (i%%1000==0){
    print(paste0("Iteration ", i, ": ", Sys.time()))
  }
  data.cv <- data[-i,]
  fit.cv <- lm(educ ~ religion + age + age2 + region + wealthCat + urban, data=data.cv)
  yhat <- predict(fit.cv, data[i,])
  err.fit3[i] <- abs(data$educ[i] - yhat)
}

err.fit4 <- NULL
for (i in 1:nrow(data)){
  if (i%%500==0){
    print(paste0("Iteration ", i, ": ", Sys.time()))
  }
  data.cv <- data[-i,]
  fit.cv <- lmer(educ ~ religion + age + age2 + wealthCat + urban + (1|region),
             data = data.cv,
             REML = FALSE)
  yhat <- predict(fit.cv, data[i,])
  err.fit4[i] <- abs(data$educ[i] - yhat)
}

mae1 <- mean(err.fit1)
mae2 <- mean(err.fit2)
mae3 <- mean(err.fit3)
mae4 <- mean(err.fit4)
```
